cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.current_location: about 80 miles NNW of Cozumel, Mexico and about 500 miles SW of Fort Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northeast on Friday and accelerate toward the southern-central Florida Peninsula Saturday, then move offshore into the Atlantic toward the western Atlantic/Bermuda area early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida Peninsula (near or just south of Port Everglades – across South Florida)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County Line (includes Port Everglades), west coast south of the middle of Longboat Key, Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee, Florida Bay, north-western Bahamas and parts of western Cuba.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South and central Florida Peninsula, Florida Keys, southeastern Gulf Coast, northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – forecast totals 4-8 inches with locally higher amounts
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (forecast 1-2 ft along Atlantic coast; 1-3 ft possible only from Marco Island to Card Sound Bridge on Gulf side)
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (39-45 mph) possible Saturday as center passes; overall probability low (≤11% for sustained 34-kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding of 1–2 ft above ground level possible at high tide; mainly low-lying areas and inlets.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Friday night–Saturday; 4–8 inches could cause urban and flash flooding in and around Port Everglades.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous marine conditions, rip currents, and possible thunderstorm lightning could disrupt cargo and cruise operations.
